title: Bojan Božović
text:
Bojan Božović (<a href="Cyrillic">Cyrillic</a>: Бојан Божовић, born 3 February 1985 in <a href="Titograd">Titograd</a>) is a <a href="Montenegro">Montenegrin</a> retired professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a>er who played as a <a href="Striker%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a>. The last club he played for on a professional level was <a href="FK%20Sutjeska%20Nik%C5%A1i%C4%87">FK Sutjeska Nikšić</a>.
Club career.
He started playing with <a href="FK%20Kom">FK Kom</a> from where he moved to Belgrade to join <a href="FK%20Hajduk%20Beograd">FK Hajduk Beograd</a> but spend most of the time playing on loan at <a href="FK%20BPI%20Slavija">FK BPI Pekar</a>.
Due to a broken <a href="foot">foot</a>, Božović missed a transfer to <a href="Hamburger%20SV">Hamburg</a> during the winter break of the <a href="Hungarian%20National%20Championship%20I%202008%E2%80%9309">2008-09 season</a>. He signed a two-year contract with <a href="Belgium">Belgian</a> <a href="Belgian%20First%20Division">Jupiler League</a> side <a href="Cercle%20Brugge%20K.S.V.">Cercle Brugge</a> in June 2009. His former teams are the Montenegrin <a href="FK%20Kom">FK Kom</a>, <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a>n <a href="Hajduk%20Beograd">Hajduk Beograd</a> and <a href="Hungary">Hungarian</a> teams <a href="B%C3%A9k%C3%A9scsaba%201912%20El%C5%91re%20SE">Békéscsaba Előre</a>, <a href="Budapest%20Honv%C3%A9d%20FC">Budapest Honvéd</a> and <a href="Kaposv%C3%A1ri%20R%C3%A1k%C3%B3czi">Kaposvári Rákóczi</a>.
He scored his first goal for Cercle against <a href="K.S.C.%20Lokeren%20Oost-Vlaanderen">Lokeren</a> on 17 October 2009: an equalizer (1-1) in the last minute of <a href="injury%20time">injury time</a>. 27 October, Božović made both goals in the 2-0 <a href="Belgian%20Cup%202009-10">cup</a> victory against <a href="Oud-Heverlee%20Leuven">OH Leuven</a> and went on to score two winning goals against R.S.C. Anderlecht helping Cercle to reach the cup final. He finished as top scorer of Belgium cup 2009–2010. In preseason 2010-11 he was told by the board of Cercle Brugge that he had to leave the club. He didn't find a team to play in before closing of the transfer period and was dropped out of the first team squad. He played a whole year with the reserve squad before moving to Hungarian team <a href="BFC%20Si%C3%B3fok">BFC Siófok</a>.
In summer 2012 he returned to Serbia joining his former club <a href="FK%20Hajduk%20Beograd">FK Hajduk Beograd</a>, playing now in the <a href="Serbian%20League%20Belgrade">Serbian League Belgrade</a>.
During the first half of 2013 he played with <a href="Chainat%20Hornbill%20F.C.">Chainat</a> in Thailand, and in summer 2013 he returned to Serbia and joined <a href="FK%20Be%C5%BEanija">FK Bežanija</a>. During the winter break of the <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20Serbian%20SuperLiga">2013–14</a> season he moved to a <a href="Serbian%20SuperLiga">Serbian SuperLiga</a> side <a href="FK%20Napredak%20Kru%C5%A1evac">FK Napredak Kruševac</a>.
During the winter break of the 2014–15 season, a year after joining Napredak, he moved to Saudi Arabia and joined <a href="Al-Shoalah">Al-Shoalah</a>.
International career.
Bojan Božović has been a youth international. He has already been called up to represent <a href="Montenegro%20national%20football%20team">Montenegro</a> at senior level, but has no appearances so far.
